intro: Lecythis rufescens, commonly known as the red-leaved lecythis, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves that turn reddish in color as they mature. The tree produces heavy, woody fruits that contain a single large, oily seed. Its bark and wood are valued for their medicinal and commercial properties. The plant is also noted for its role in supporting local biodiversity in rainforest ecosystems.
